column5: Left the shop today just after noon had enough for one day and decoded to hit my favorite lake see if i could scare up some crappies. First spot didn't pan out water temp was a little low and water real low, next spot I hit water temp was 56-57 hit a school a bull sunnies and perch entertaining for a while pressed on in the bay i was in seen schools of minnows lots of lm bass cruising the shore, caught more sunnies and a couple rock bass, decided to do a run on the lake an on spot number 3 for the day water temps were 57-8 in the early afternoon and found the crappies finally in 18 inches of water spent the next 2 hours or 230 to 430 hitting one after another without a boat in sight fish were hitting real light though crappies were barely taking the bobber down it would quiver and move a bit it was usually a crappie, straight down usually a gill. kept a few for the table including 5 suicidal gills.  showing off for the neighbour.  live well yum breakfast  one of the better ones
Awesome report! Thanks for including water temps and depths...something to aim for up here
It's always fun catching them one after the other once your able to locate them   Nice going ecmilley
Awesome, I've only ever eaten 1 crappie and it was so good, wish i knew or could catch some of them for a nice meal
Good fishing.  The craps make a nice transition from ice fishing to the openers of other fish.  Watching the floats drop is fine fun.
Nice job!  Thanks for sharing,  MTBF
